episodeTitle: Shocking! The True Identity of the Mystery Man Vergo!
episodeTitleJapanese: 衝撃！謎の男ヴェルゴの正体！
episodeTitleRomanized: Shōgeki! Nazo no Otoko Verugo no Shōtai!
description: Law is brutally beaten by Vergo while imprisoned in Caesar's lab. The parents on a distant island discover their children were kidnapped. Caesar recaptures the children from Nami and Usopp by bribing them with candy. Law reveals Vergo's shocking true identity: he is a pirate working for Joker, who is revealed to be none other than Shichibukai Donquixote Doflamingo.

events.title: Vergo Revealed as Doflamingo's Subordinate
events.description: Law reveals the shocking truth that Vergo is not truly a Marine, but has always been a pirate working undercover for Joker (Donquixote Doflamingo). Vergo spent 15 years infiltrating the Marines to reach the rank of Vice Admiral and G-5 base commander.
events.significance: This reveal establishes Doflamingo's extensive underground network and his ability to infiltrate the highest levels of Marine command. It also explains how the kidnapped children conspiracy was covered up and shows the depth of corruption in the Marines.

quotes.text: Vergo was never really loyal to the marines because he was originally a pirate all along, working for the notorious underworld broker Joker.
quotes.speaker: Trafalgar Law
quotes.context: Law explaining Vergo's true allegiance to the imprisoned crew

quotes.text: Someone that you all know who is a notorious pirate that works for the World Government. None other than, one of the Shichibukai Donquixote Doflamingo.
quotes.speaker: Trafalgar Law

events.title: Law Beaten by Vergo
events.description: Vergo brutally beats the imprisoned Trafalgar Law, demonstrating his overwhelming physical power and Haki abilities. Law is chained with Seastone and unable to use his Devil Fruit powers to defend himself.
events.significance: Shows Vergo's strength and cruelty, establishing him as a serious threat. Also demonstrates Law's vulnerable position and the consequences of being captured.

events.title: Parents Discover Children Were Kidnapped
events.description: On an unnamed island in the New World, desperate parents plead with Marine Commodore Yarisugi for help finding their missing children. Yarisugi coldly tells them that their children are dead, following Vergo's falsified reports. The parents are devastated to learn the truth about their kidnapped children.
events.significance: Reveals the human cost of Caesar and Vergo's conspiracy. Shows how Vergo's Marine position allowed him to cover up the kidnappings by falsifying reports, preventing any investigation.

events.title: Caesar Recaptures the Children
events.description: Caesar Clown appears before Nami, Usopp, and the kidnapped children who are suffering severe withdrawal symptoms from the addictive NHC10 candy. He bribes them with more candy, and the desperate children abandon the Straw Hats to follow Caesar back to the laboratory.
events.significance: Shows Caesar's manipulation of the children through addiction and demonstrates how the children's dependency makes them willing prisoners. This creates urgency for rescuing them before they're further harmed.

events.title: Monet Introduced to Prisoners
events.description: Luffy, Law, Robin, Franky, Tashigi, and Smoker are confined in a prison cell when they are formally introduced to both Vergo and Monet. Monet serves as Caesar's assistant and surveillance coordinator.
events.significance: First direct interaction between the imprisoned heroes and Monet, establishing her role in the facility and her connection to the villains.

events.title: Vergo's Indifference to His Subordinates
events.description: Smoker confronts Vergo about the G-5 Marines trapped outside the laboratory facing the deadly Smiley. Vergo shows complete indifference to his subordinates' fate, revealing his true nature and priorities.
events.significance: Demonstrates that Vergo never cared about the Marines under his command, further establishing him as a villain who only served Doflamingo's interests.

events.title: Smiley Chases Zoro's Group
events.description: The poisonous slime creature Smiley takes the form of an axolotl and pursues Zoro, Sanji, Brook, and Kin'emon with massive poisonous attacks. The group flees toward the research facility, unable to effectively fight the creature.
events.significance: Escalates the danger on Punk Hazard as the heroes are pursued by a creature they cannot defeat through normal combat. Shows Smiley's Devil Fruit abilities in action.

events.title: G-5 Marines Trapped Outside Laboratory
events.description: Caesar Clown's soldiers seal all entrances to the laboratory, leaving the G-5 Marines stranded outside to face the deadly Smiley without any shelter or escape route.
events.significance: Creates a desperate situation for the Marines and shows Caesar's ruthlessness in sacrificing anyone to test his weapons.

events.title: Law's Past Connection to Doflamingo
events.description: Law reveals that he also once worked for Doflamingo, establishing a personal history between them and explaining how Law knows so much about Vergo and Doflamingo's operations.
events.significance: Adds depth to Law's character and motivations. Explains his knowledge of the Donquixote Family and foreshadows future confrontations with Doflamingo.

quotes.text: I also worked for him once.
quotes.speaker: Trafalgar Law
quotes.context: Law revealing his past connection to Doflamingo

events.title: Commodore Yarisugi's Appearance
events.description: Marine Commodore Yarisugi appears on the island where the children's parents live, serving as the local Marine authority. He dismisses the parents' pleas and delivers the false news that their children are dead.
events.significance: Introduces Yarisugi as a minor character who unknowingly perpetuates Vergo's cover-up by trusting falsified reports.

themes.description: The episode heavily explores themes of betrayal through Vergo's reveal as a deep-cover pirate who infiltrated the Marines. His 15-year deception represents one of the most extensive betrayals in the series.
themes.symbolism: Vergo's Marine coat represents a false identity and the corruption that can exist within supposedly just institutions.

themes.description: Caesar's manipulation of children and Doflamingo's use of Vergo show how far villains will go to achieve their goals, regardless of human cost.
themes.symbolism: The addicted children represent innocence corrupted by adult ambition and greed.

themes.description: Law's revelation that he once worked for Doflamingo adds layers to his character and shows how past relationships continue to impact the present.

characterSpotlights.development: Law reveals crucial information about Vergo and Doflamingo while enduring torture. His past connection to Doflamingo is revealed, adding complexity to his character.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime adds a scene with Yarisugi buying apples in the market before meeting the parents.
The anime includes an extended scene where Yarisugi thinks about Tashigi and sees a cloud shaped like her.

trivia.fact: This episode adapts only Chapter 673 of the manga (pages 2-19), maintaining a relatively tight pacing for the Punk Hazard arc.
Episode 599 marks the major reveal of Doflamingo as Joker, a mystery that had been building since the mention of Joker earlier in the arc.
This episode aired during the period when One Piece did not use ending themes, which lasted from Episode 279 to Episode 1070 - a span of 17 years.
Vergo's 15-year infiltration of the Marines represents one of the longest-running undercover operations revealed in One Piece.
